column2: title=The Book of Kyng Arthur: The Unity of Malory's Morte Darthur
noisbn=Library of Congress Catalog Card No. 65-11825

column1: '''''The Book of Kyng Arthur: The Unity of Malory's Morte Darthur''''' is a 1965 study by [[Charles Moorman]] of the ''[[Wikipedia:Le Morte d'Arthur
column2: Morte Darthur]]''. The Prologue includes a [[Index:Reminiscences of J.R.R. Tolkien

column1: ...I once told Professor J.R.R. Tolkien with great smugness that I was sure, judging from the great number of foreshadowing passages in the early parts of ''The Lord of the Rings'', that he had had the whole narrative in mind before he set pen to paper. Tolkien immediately informed me in no uncertain terms that he had rewritten the first section of the work in the light of it conclusion not once but many times and that it had been a very difficult job indeed. (p. xxix)
